text: this is cream of cauliflower with fried
oysters very unusual sounding and
extremely delicious and I hope you give
this a try starts off very simply my god
as they say in England a knob of butter
it's a couple tablespoons of whole
butter sweet butter I have one shallot
that I sliced and two cloves of garlic
that I sliced now we're going to puree
all this later so it really doesn't
matter you don't have to do a fine dice
on those but slice them up and a nice
big pinch of salt and on a really low
heat
I just want to sweat and soften those
slices of garlic and slice the shallot
for about ten minutes very slowly okay I
don't want any color on so about ten
minutes on low heat I added two heads of
cauliflower that I cleaned it's pretty
much just the tops all right now
sometimes the cauliflower comes in those
gigantic heads if you get the large ones
use one of those right I had to kind of
small to medium heads about pound and
half all together and to that I'm gonna
add a quart of chicken stock now I
really like this kitchen basics brand
chicken stock it is really nice rich
flavor it is a little dark they use
these roasted bones I believe so that
didn't bother me but if you want to come
on maybe a little lighter you could go
with just a regular chicken stock or
even a vegetable stock now I'm going to
simmer that for about 20 minutes until
the cauliflower is nice and tender all
right now I'm not gonna cover this I
don't mind a little bit of that stock
reducing because I do want this to be a
fairly thick puree and you know I love
my stick blender okay now if you want
pour this in a blender be careful you
can blend it like that to me so much
harder so much more trouble get one of
these stick blenders only about
twenty-five thirty dollars save so much
work they're so easy to clean and you'll
notice I'm just kind of turning it on
and off when I see a big chunk i pounds
down on it once all the major chunks are
purified then you can kind of tilt it up
a little bit and you really get
really nice smooth very very fine puree
and that's pretty much done now to make
a cream of cauliflower you need yes
cream I'm gonna put in a half a cup of
whole cream or heavy cream and give it
one more blend and again you could just
stir this with a spoon but I really like
how the stick blender kind of aerates it
and it makes a little frothy and just
gives it a really nice light texture and
again it's fairly thick but it's not you
know it's not to like mashed potato it's
it's just got a nice smooth silky
texture now what we're gonna garnish
this slightly unusual dish with is
sharable it's kind of a leafy almost
like fern like parsley really delicate
flavor really unique trying to find some
if you can you can use parsley I got two
jars of that's Pacific oysters they're
north-northwest I think they're from a
hog island I believe but those around
special at the store they were already
shucked in the jar now before you put
them in your seasoned flour and by the
way all the details are on the site is
usual before you put them in the
seasoned flour make sure you drain them
really well otherwise you're just gonna
get a big lump of sticky flour so I
drained the oysters well I shook them in
my seasoned flour seasoned flour salt
pepper a little hot pepper we're gonna
dredge them in some egg and then it's a
bread crumb so we're doing the
traditional flour egg bread crumb
classic breading mix again you've seen
me do this before if you keep one hand
dry and you only use one hand for the
bread crumb you're not gonna have a big
mess on your hand okay so in the flour
that in the egg then in the bread crumb
and then what I do is I have a plate
that I also put a nice thick layer of
bread crumbs down and when I'm done
breading one I put it on the plate
because it still will absorb some of the
some of the bread crumbs so if you put
it on a dry plate it gets a little wet
underneath now I don't have a
thermometer okay if you do get your oil
to about 360 370 but what I do is I put
in just a little piece that fell off a
little chunk of bread crumb and if it
bubbles and Browns I know I'm good
so I just have so much experience with
this I know when my oils hot you know I
suggest you get a thermometer then you
know
it's exact so go about 370 and these are
gonna cook quick I'm warning ya I did
about four to time I just for the size
pan I was using and this only took about
maybe two minutes alright I want him a
nice golden brown now golden brown and
golden black different okay so I want to
get a good brown on and I want a nice
crispy crunchy coating alright still
nice and succulent juicy inside but have
your spider that's what that strainer is
called have your spider ready so as soon
as those are perfect you can get him out
put him on a towel and then I put a nice
ladle of my puree in to the bowl garnish
with my fresh chervil and that was just
a really really interesting creative
dish I thought I stole this as you'll
read on the site from chef Thomas Keller
of the famous French Laundry he actually
served this dish cold with a fresh
oyster on a color flour panna cotta so
anyway you'll read about that on the
site but this is just a really really
unique dish the kind of briny slightly
salty oyster along with that smooth
silky cauliflower puree it just really
works and it's a it's kind of a take on
a classic oyster stew which is always
cooked in milk anyway I really hope you
try this it's not hard enjoy
you
